name: New Horizon Weftscapes: A Jamdani Indigo Showcase   - A Showcase of Indian Kimonos by Bappaditya Biswas (Bai Lou) - Aug 01
description: Explore an evocative showcase of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos by acclaimed textile artist and social entrepreneur Bappaditya Biswas. Known for revitalising Bengal's handloom traditions through innovative materials and storytelling, Biswas presents a contemporary interpretation of Jamdani that challenges boundaries—of craft, geography, and garment. Alongside the exhibition, join us for an artist talk on July 26,  (RSVP separately)  where he shares insights into his process, his use of organic indigo, and the evolving identity of handloom weaving in India. About Bappaditya Biswas:  Bappaditya Biswas is a leading Indian textile artist and social entrepreneur, renowned for his innovative contributions to Bengal handloom weaving. He co-founded the brand Bai Lou and the iconic Kolkata store Byloom, both of which merge traditional craftsmanship with contemporary aesthetics. Biswas has traveled globally to study dyeing and weaving traditions, and one of his weaves has been honored with the UNESCO Seal of Excellence. The brand's work has been showcased in various exhibitions, including "The Chintz Story" at Gallery Threshold in Delhi, which highlighted Biswas's remarkable body of work

name: New Horizon Weftscapes: In Conversation with Madhu Nataraj & Bappaditya Biswas - A part of an exhibition of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos
description: What do textiles and choreography have in common? Join acclaimed choreographer and arts entrepreneur Madhu Nataraj (Director, Naatya Institute of Kathak & Choreography) and celebrated textile artist Bappaditya Biswas for a rich, interdisciplinary conversation on tradition, innovation, and the body in motion—whether through fabric or dance. This dialogue accompanies Weftscapes, an exhibition of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos by Bappaditya Biswas, on view at Sabha from July 24–27. Free and open to the public.
